model

Class GameRules

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.GameRules

  • public class GameRules
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the rules of Conway's Game of Life. GameRules can load, edit and save rules. The rules are saved and taken in as String objects, where the format of the String is the same format for Rule Strings in RLE-files. The rules are validated and checked if they are correct, if they are incorrect, the user is informed. All the rules are added into a RuleCollection arrayList, where each rule has is its own index.
    Author:
    Kent Erlend Bratteng Knudsen

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameRules

        private GameRules()
        GameRules 
        private GameRules()

        RulesBirth and RuleSurvive array is created with 9 empty elements.

        The rules are Set to the default rules for Conway's Game of Life(s23/b3), if a invalid rule is selected, or no rule is selected at all.

      • getInstance

        public static GameRules getInstance()
        getInstance 
        public static GameRules getInstance()

        If the reference to a gameRule is empty, a reference to the class GameRules is created, and returns its instance.

        Returns:
        - Reference to the GameRule object.

      • loadRulesFile

        public void loadRulesFile()
        loadRulesFile 
        public void loadRulesFile()

        The rules are loaded from Rules file , which has the extension "*.bin".

        The title, name, RuleString and description of the rule is read, and added into the list of existing rules.

        See Also:
        - Throws an error if the "rules.ser" file can not be loaded.

      • saveRulesFile

        public void saveRulesFile()
        saveRulesFile 
        public void saveRulesFile()

        Saves the rules in the RulesCollection array to the Rule file with extension ".ser".

        See Also:

        ruleString - - the RuleString- the survival and birth rate.
        ruleDescription - - the description of the rule.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -

      • checkRules

        public boolean checkRules(boolean cellState,
                          int neighbours)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        checkRules 
        public boolean checkRules(boolean cellState, int neighbours)

        Checks if a cell should be alive or dead according to defined rules and returns its new state.

        Parameters:
        cellState - - boolean value defining a cell's state.
        neighbours - - byte value between 0..8 holding the count of alive neighbors next to a cell.
        Returns:
        - returns a boolean value of the cell's new state set by the rules.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If the neighbors is not between 0 and 8, an exception is thrown.

      • ruleStringFormat

        public static GameRules.RuleFormat ruleStringFormat(java.lang.String ruleString)
        ruleStringFormat 
        public static GameRules.RuleFormat ruleStringFormat(String ruleString)

        Trims the RuleString for white space, and filters the birth and survival values.

        Parameters:
        ruleString - - Trims the rule String.
        Returns:
        RuleFormatValues - returns the survival and birth values of the RuleString
